topic.title: Creating a page

bullets.item: There is no button or link in Mingle for creating pages. You must create pages manually as described above.
Page names are case sensitive, so "My page" is not the same as "my page".

topic.p: There are two ways to create a page:

subsection.title: Create a page on another page or card
subsection.p: Create a new link on an existing page (the Overview tab is a page) or card. While editing a card or page, type the following to create a page called new page name: [[new page name]]
When you save the card or page, you'll see a new link. Click this link to edit the new page.

screenshot.alttext: A newly created wiki page link

subsection.title: Create a page via URL
subsection.p:
You can also create a page by typing a new URL directly into your browser's address bar. For example, typing the following will create a page called demo_page:
http://mingle.yourcompany.com/projects/your_project/wiki/demo_page
In this case you will be taken directly to the new page and can begin editing its content using Mingle's WYSIWYG editor.

bullets.item: A quick way to do this is by navigating to the page list (in the Project admin tab), and replacing the /list at the end of the browser URL with the desired page name.
